title: Clustering of Tidy Tuesday Superbowl ads
contents:
load libraries


library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(skimr)
library(snakecase)
library(janitor)
library(broom)
library(plotly)
library(htmlwidgets)
library(DT)

#set the theme
theme_set(theme_minimal())



Read in the data
Read in and look at the data


sb_raw <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2021/2021-03-02/youtube.csv')
skimr::skim(sb_raw)

2006-02-06 10:02:36

2013-01-31 09:13:55
227

dat_ref <- "data from https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/superbowl-ads, via tidy tuesday"



look at the data


sb_raw %>% sample_n(10)


# A tibble: 10 x 25
    year brand  superbowl_ads_dot~ youtube_url  funny show_product_qu~
   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>              <chr>        <lgl> <lgl>           
 1  2007 Budwe~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ TRUE  TRUE            
 2  2015 Budwe~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ FALSE TRUE            
 3  2004 Bud L~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ TRUE  TRUE            
 4  2006 Bud L~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ TRUE  FALSE           
 5  2000 Budwe~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ TRUE  TRUE            
 6  2009 Dorit~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ TRUE  TRUE            
 7  2019 Kia    https://superbowl~ https://www~ FALSE FALSE           
 8  2013 Budwe~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ FALSE TRUE            
 9  2014 Coca-~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ FALSE TRUE            
10  2009 Coca-~ https://superbowl~ https://www~ TRUE  TRUE            
# ... with 19 more variables: patriotic <lgl>, celebrity <lgl>,
#   danger <lgl>, animals <lgl>, use_sex <lgl>, id <chr>, kind <chr>,
#   etag <chr>, view_count <dbl>, like_count <dbl>,
#   dislike_count <dbl>, favorite_count <dbl>, comment_count <dbl>,
#   published_at <dttm>, title <chr>, description <chr>,
#   thumbnail <chr>, channel_title <chr>, category_id <dbl>

clean the data a little bit


dat <- 
  sb_raw %>% 
  mutate_if(is.character, snakecase::to_sentence_case) %>% 
  select(-favorite_count, -youtube_url) %>%
  bind_cols(sb_raw["youtube_url"],. ) %>%
  rename(key = youtube_url)
 

dat %>% colnames()


 [1] "key"                       "year"                     
 [3] "brand"                     "superbowl_ads_dot_com_url"
 [5] "funny"                     "show_product_quickly"     
 [7] "patriotic"                 "celebrity"                
 [9] "danger"                    "animals"                  
[11] "use_sex"                   "id"                       
[13] "kind"                      "etag"                     
[15] "view_count"                "like_count"               
[17] "dislike_count"             "comment_count"            
[19] "published_at"              "title"                    
[21] "description"               "thumbnail"                
[23] "channel_title"             "category_id"              

Elbo method of guessing at clusters


dat_4_clust <- 
  dat %>% 
  mutate_if(is.numeric, function(x){(x+1) %>% log10() %>%  scale() }) %>% 
  drop_na()

dat_4_clust_2 <- 
  dat_4_clust %>% 
  select_if(function(x){is.logical(x) | is.numeric(x)})%>%
  bind_cols(dat_4_clust["key"],.) %>% 
  drop_na()


kclusts <-
  tibble(k = 1:12) %>%
  mutate(
    kclust = map(k, function(x){kmeans(x = select(dat_4_clust_2, -key), centers = x)})) %>% 
  mutate(glanced = map(kclust, glance))


kclusts %>%
  unnest(cols = c(glanced)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(k, tot.withinss)) +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.5, size = 1.2) +
  geom_point(size = 2) + 
  labs(caption = dat_ref , title = "Guess at cluster count via elbo method", y = "Total Withiness", x = "number of clusters")






#best cluster ???
final_clust <- kmeans(select(dat_4_clust_2, -key), centers = 7)


p <-
  augment(final_clust, dat_4_clust_2) %>%
  left_join(dat %>% select(brand, key), by = "key") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(dislike_count, like_count, fill = .cluster, name = brand)) +
  geom_point(aes(size = view_count), shape = 21, color = "black") +
  geom_text(aes(label  = brand), check_overlap = TRUE, hjust = "right") +
  guides( fill = "none") + 
  labs(title = "Clustering of NFL commercials", y = "likes (normalized)", x = "dislikes (normalized)", 
       size = "views (normalized)",
       caption = dat_ref )

p



#pp <- ggplotly(p)
#pp
